item.title: ITC Hotels Demerger Live Updates: ITC shares trade ex-hotels; discovered price at ₹455.60 on NSE | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
ITC Hotels Demerger Live Updates: ITC shares trade ex-hotels; discovered price at ₹455.60 on NSE

Date: 06 Jan 2025

Source: LiveMint

ITC Hotels demerger record date was today, and the discovered price of ITC shares during a special trading session on the NSE is ₹455.60 apiece.

  • ITC shares are trading ex-hotels as the demerger record date has formally been executed.
  • The stock was adjusted by ₹26 or 5.4% at ₹455.60 on NSE.
  • ITC Hotels demerger ratio is 1:10, meaning shareholders receive one share of ITC Hotels for every ten ITC shares held.
  • The listing date for ITC Hotels will be announced soon.
  • Expectations for ITC Hotels listing price range between ₹100-170 based on peer valuations.
“The demerger is expected to unlock substantial shareholder value and allow ITC Hotels to focus on growth.” - Prashanth Tapse, Senior VP (Research), Mehta Equities Ltd.

This demerger is a significant event for ITC Ltd shareholders, as it allows for direct investment in the growing hotel sector.

item.title: Redmi 14C 5G launched with 120 Hz refresh rate and Snapdragon processor for budget buyers in India - The Hindu
item.description:
Redmi 14C 5G launched with 120 Hz refresh rate and Snapdragon processor for budget buyers in India

Date & Source: January 06, 2025 - The Hindu

Xiaomi has introduced its first smartphone of 2025, the budget-friendly Redmi 14C 5G, offering impressive specifications and features for cost-conscious consumers.

  • 6.88 inch HD+ punch hole display with 120 Hz refresh rate.
  • Powered by Snapdragon 4 Gen 2 processor with options up to 6 GB RAM and 128 GB storage.
  • Equipped with a 5,160 mAh battery with 33 W charger and supports 18 W charging.
  • Features a 50 MP camera and an 8 MP front camera.
  • Prices start at ₹9,999 for the base model, with the device available in three colors.
  • Sales begin on January 10 through various online platforms.
Xiaomi has priced the Redmi 14C 5G at ₹9,999 for 4 GB/64 GB, while the 4 GB/128 GB model will sell for ₹10,999 and the 6 GB/128 GB at ₹11,999.

The Redmi 14C 5G is positioned as a compelling option in the budget smartphone segment, offering high specifications at an accessible price.

item.title: ​6 Amazing Pictures Of Interacting Galaxies Captured By NASA Telescope ​ - Times Now
item.description:
6 Amazing Pictures Of Interacting Galaxies Captured By NASA Telescope

Date: Jan 6, 2025 Source: Times Now

This article showcases stunning images of interacting galaxies captured by NASA's Hubble Space Telescope, highlighting their unique features and beauty.

  • Image of NGC 7049 showing a collection of globular clusters.
  • Portrait of Stephan’s Quintet, a group of five galaxies including a foreground galaxy.
  • NGC 5128 known for its dramatic dark lanes of dusty material.
  • NGC 3717, a beautiful spiral galaxy located about 60 million light-years away.
  • NGC 1316, depicting the results of a merger between two galaxies.
  • Arp 148 showing a ring-shaped galaxy involved in a collision.
“It has intricate loops and blobs of cosmic dust, evidence of past galactic mergers.”

This collection of images emphasizes the complexity and dynamic nature of our universe as seen through NASA's advanced technologies.

item.title: Markets extend losses: NIFTY50 and SENSEX fall over 1%, HDFC Bank, Kotak Bank and Reliance among top index movers - Upstox
item.description:
Markets extend losses: NIFTY50 and SENSEX fall over 1%, HDFC Bank, Kotak Bank and Reliance among top index movers

Date: January 6, 2023 | Source: Financial News

Indian equity benchmarks extended morning losses in the mid-market session, with foreign portfolio investors continuing their selling spree as traders awaited Q3 earnings season cues.

The main points highlighted in this article include:

  • Foreign institutional investors sold ₹4,227.25 crore in capital markets on Friday.
  • SENSEX traded down by 0.95% at 78530.57, while NIFTY50 fell 1.01% to 23764.85.
  • The broader indices were also in decline; BSE mid-cap down 1.27%, small-cap down 1.64%.
  • HDFC Bank shares dropped due to slowed credit growth updates.
  • Titan shares rallied over 2% backed by strong Q3FY25 growth, with a 24% YoY revenue increase.
  • Asian markets mostly traded in the red, with some noteworthy declines in major indices.
“Investors are wary of taking on more risk in light of looming US-China trade tensions.”

This article provides insight into the cautious sentiment prevailing in the Indian stock markets, primarily driven by foreign selling and awaiting the upcoming earnings reports.

item.title: CES 2025: Samsung unveils AI-powered Neo QLED TVs, The Frame Pro, and more - Business Standard
item.description:
Samsung Unveils AI-Powered Neo QLED TVs and Innovative Devices at CES 2025

Publication Date: Jan 06 2025 | Source: Business Standard

At CES 2025 in Las Vegas, Samsung introduced a new lineup of AI-enhanced devices, including the Neo QLED TV, The Frame Pro, and a series of projectors, showcasing advancements in home entertainment technology.

  • Samsung launched its 2025 TV line-up featuring new Neo QLED, OLED, and QLED models.
  • The flagship Neo QLED 8K QN990F TV employs Vision AI features for enhanced viewing experience.
  • The Frame Pro enhances artwork display quality while introducing new content from famous estates.
  • New interactive projector called The Premiere 5 with advanced features for user engagement.
  • Samsung's Ballie robots returned, with enhanced capabilities including a built-in projector.
“Samsung said that the new flagship TV model blends cutting-edge technology with an ultra-slim, minimalist design.”

Samsung's innovations at CES 2025 highlight their commitment to integrating AI into consumer electronics, pushing the boundaries of how users experience home entertainment.

item.title: Emergency trailer: Kangana Ranaut's Indira Gandhi declares herself the Cabinet, film aims to show untold history. Watch - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Emergency trailer: Kangana Ranaut's Indira Gandhi declares herself the Cabinet, film aims to show untold history

Date: Jan 06, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The trailer for the film Emergency, featuring Kangana Ranaut as former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, has been released. The trailer portrays key historical events during the Emergency period in India.

  • Kangana portrays Indira Gandhi declaring herself the Cabinet.
  • Anupam Kher plays Jayaprakash Narayan, who communicates with Gandhi from jail.
  • The film depicts portrayal of violence and chaos during the Emergency.
  • Kangana tweeted about the film highlighting the historical significance of the Emergency and Gandhi's influence.
  • Other cast members include Shreyas Talpade as Atal Bihari Vajpayee and Mahima Chaudhry as Pupul Jayakar.
  • The film is set to release on January 17, 2025.
“1975, Emergency — A Defining chapter in Indian History. Indira: India’s most powerful woman. Her ambition transformed the nation, but her #EMERGENCY plunged it into chaos.” - Kangana Ranaut

The movie aims to offer a deep dive into the political climate and events during one of India's most tumultuous periods.

item.title: High drama outside Telangana ACB office as KTR refuses to go in without lawyer, calls CM Revanth Reddy ‘third-rate criminal’ - The Indian Express
item.description:
High drama outside Telangana ACB office as KTR refuses to go in without lawyer, calls CM Revanth Reddy ‘third-rate criminal’

Publication Date: Monday

Source: [Your News Source]

On Monday morning, K T Rama Rao, the working president of Bharat Rashtra Samiti, found himself in a standoff with the Telangana Anti Corruption Bureau. He refused to enter the ACB office without his lawyer present, leading to significant drama outside the agency’s premises.

  • KTR stated that the ACB barred his lawyer from attending while his statement was recorded.
  • After 45 minutes in their vehicle, KTR left without giving his statement, having submitted a lawyer's response to the ACB notice.
  • He asserted his right to have legal representation during questioning, citing concerns over trust towards the ACB and past incidents involving other politicians.
  • The ACB had summoned him regarding the Formula E race case, linked to an alleged financial transfer to a foreign company.
  • KTR has challenged the ACB's FIR against him in the High Court, which has yet to issue a ruling.
“I do not trust this government and the police are acting under the instructions of a third-rate criminal like Revanth Reddy,” KTR claimed.

The situation has raised questions about legal rights and procedural integrity as KTR awaits further developments in his case.

item.title: First HMPV cases in India: Two Bengaluru infants test positive - The Times of India
item.description:
First HMPV Cases Reported in India: Two Infants in Bengaluru Test Positive

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

This article discusses the first reported cases of human metapneumovirus (HMPV) in India, specifically in Bengaluru, where two infants have tested positive.

  • HMPV is known to cause respiratory infections.
  • The affected infants are currently receiving treatment and are being monitored.
  • Health officials are urging the public to be vigilant in recognizing symptoms.
  • Awareness campaigns are being planned to educate parents about HMPV.
"It's crucial for parents to watch for respiratory symptoms in their children and seek medical help if necessary."

The emergence of HMPV cases in India highlights the need for heightened awareness and preparedness in handling respiratory infections, particularly among young children.

item.title: 'Emergency' trailer 2: Kangana Ranaut makes a hard-hitting impact as Indira Gandhi as the film promises t - TOI Etimes
item.description:
'Emergency' Trailer 2: Kangana Ranaut's Hard-Hitting Portrayal of Indira Gandhi

Publication Date: [Date not provided] | Source: [Source not provided]

This long-awaited film, set to release on January 17, 2025, marks the 50th anniversary of India's emergency declaration in 1975. The trailer showcases Kangana's transformation into Indira Gandhi, highlighting the gripping narrative the film promises to deliver.

  • The release was delayed due to censor board issues but has now received a U/A certification with suggested cuts.
  • The trailer depicts how Gandhi declared an 'Emergency' in India, emphasizing her powerful dialogue.
  • Kangana expressed gratitude for finally bringing this significant story to the big screen, especially as it resonates with current themes.
  • The film features Anupam Kher, Shreyas Talpade, and Milind Soman among others.
Kangana Ranaut: "This story isn't just about a controversial leader; it delves into themes that remain profoundly relevant today."

Overall, 'Emergency' aims to not only tell a historical tale but also provoke reflection on constitutional resilience.

item.title: Video shows crowd mocking injured US cop thrown from car during arrest - The Times of India
item.description:
Video Shows Crowd Mocking Injured US Cop Thrown from Car During Arrest

Date: October 21, 2023

Source: Example News Source

Disturbing footage has emerged showing a crowd mocking an injured police officer who was thrown from a vehicle during an arrest attempt. The incident has raised serious concerns about public attitudes towards law enforcement and the safety of officers in the line of duty.

  • The police officer was injured while attempting to make an arrest.
  • The crowd's reaction has drawn widespread condemnation from various community leaders.
  • Calls for increased safety measures for law enforcement personnel have intensified.
“This is an unprecedented level of disrespect towards our officers,” commented a local police chief.

There is a growing discussion about the challenges faced by police in maintaining order and safety in increasingly hostile environments.

item.title: HMPV: 8-month-old at Bengaluru hospital suspected to have tested positive - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Infant in Bengaluru Suspected to Test Positive for HMPV

Date: Jan 06, 2025 Source: HT News

An eight-month-old infant in Bengaluru is suspected to have tested positive for Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV). The family reported no recent travel history and showed no symptoms of concern.

  • The infant's sample was collected on January 2.
  • Health department officials have acknowledged the lab findings but have not independently verified them.
  • HMPV primarily affects children and is associated with about 0.7% of flu cases globally.
  • There are ongoing concerns about HMPV in relation to outbreaks in China.
“We trust the accuracy of their testing procedures,” a health department official stated.

While there is speculation about the virus, health authorities report no immediate cause for alarm.

item.title: 8-month-old at Bengaluru hospital is first suspected HMPV case in India - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Bengaluru Hospital Reports First Suspected Case of HMPV in India

Date: Jan 06, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

An eight-month-old infant is suspected to have tested positive for Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) at a hospital in Bengaluru. The infant's family has no recent travel history and shows no concerning symptoms.

  • The infant's sample was collected on January 2, 2025.
  • The state health department has not verified the results but trusts the private facility's testing accuracy.
  • HMPV is known to primarily affect children and is present in approximately 0.7% of global flu cases.
  • Health officials in Karnataka have stated they lack detailed information on the specific strain.
  • There are current concerns regarding HMPV's spread in China, but health authorities claim there is nothing to alarm about.
“We trust the accuracy of their testing procedures,” - health department official.

This case marks a significant development in public health as the first suspected instance of HMPV in India, highlighting the need for awareness and monitoring of respiratory infections, especially with ongoing concerns about viral outbreaks globally.

item.title: Tamil Nadu Governor R.N. Ravi walks out of Assembly without reading customary address - The Hindu
item.description:
Tamil Nadu Governor R.N. Ravi Walks Out of Assembly Session

Date: January 06, 2025 Source: The Hindu

Tamil Nadu Governor R.N. Ravi left the Assembly without delivering his customary address due to a conflict regarding the playing of the national anthem.

  • The Governor insisted that the national anthem should be played after the state anthem, which did not happen.
  • Raj Bhavan criticized the Assembly for not respecting the national anthem, describing the incident as an insult to the Constitution.
  • The Governor remained in the House for only three minutes before leaving in protest.
  • After his departure, the main opposition party protested, demanding justice for a recent sexual assault incident at a university.
  • This incident marks the second consecutive Assembly session where the Governor has walked out.
“The Constitution of Bharat and the National Anthem were once again insulted in the Tamil Nadu Assembly today.” - Raj Bhavan Statement

The controversy surrounding the Governor's exit reinforces tensions between state officials and the Governor's office on ceremonial matters.

item.title: Tamil Nadu Governor walks out of Assembly without reading address - The Hindu
item.description:
Tamil Nadu Governor R.N. Ravi walks out of Assembly without reading customary address

Date: January 06, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

Tamil Nadu Governor R.N. Ravi departed the State Assembly session on January 6, 2025, without delivering his customary address after expressing his dissatisfaction over the national anthem not being played following the State anthem.

  • The Governor insisted on the national anthem being played but it was not.
  • The Raj Bhavan stated that the incident was an insult to the Constitution and the National Anthem.
  • Mr. Ravi was present for only about three minutes before leaving the House.
  • After his departure, AIADMK members held protests regarding a sexual assault case at Anna University.
  • This is not the first time the Governor has walked out of the Assembly; similar incidents occurred in February 2024 and January 2023.
“Not to be a party to such brazen disrespect to the Constitution and the National Anthem, Governor in deep anguish left the House.”

The incident raises serious questions about the respect for constitutional duties within the Assembly, echoing previous instances of conflict between the Governor and the government.

item.title: Main accused in journalist’s murder in Chhattisgarh arrested from Hyderabad - The Indian Express
item.description:
Main accused in Chhattisgarh journalist Mukesh Chandrakar’s murder arrested in Hyderabad

Date: Sunday, Publication Source: The Indian Express

The Chhattisgarh police have arrested Suresh Chandrakar, the alleged main accused in the murder of journalist Mukesh Chandrakar, from Telangana. The arrest comes after a series of detentions related to the case.

  • Suresh was arrested late at night on Sunday.
  • Three others, including Suresh's brothers, were previously arrested in connection to the murder.
  • Mukesh was reportedly murdered due to interference in his cousin's construction work.
  • Authorities demolished illegal property belonging to Suresh following the murder.
  • Mukesh's body was found in a septic tank a day after he was reported missing.
  • Mukesh was a freelancer with connections to prominent media outlets.
“As a journalist, my colleague paid the ultimate price for exposing the truth...” - Anurag Dwary, Resident Editor, NDTV

This incident highlights the dangers journalists face while pursuing accountability in their work. The ongoing investigation aims to ensure justice for Mukesh Chandrakar.

item.title: Nykaa Q3 update out. Is it wise to buy Nykaa shares ahead of Q3FY25 results? | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Nykaa Q3 Update: Should You Buy Shares Before Results?

Date: [Insert Publication Date]Source: Live Mint

After a substantial Q3 update for FY 2024-25, Nykaa's share price opened positively, reaching an intraday high of ₹176.60. Market experts are optimistic about the stock's short-term targets.

Key Points:

  • Nykaa's Fashion vertical expected to achieve 20% net revenue growth.
  • The beauty vertical shows strong growth, with GMV projected in the low thirties.
  • Analysts recommend a buy-on-dips strategy, aiming for a target price of ₹185.
  • Superstore by Nykaa accounts for 8% of beauty GMV, servicing over 260,000 retailers.
“Fresh investors can buy the scrip at the current market price and maintain a buy-on-dips strategy.” - Mahesh M Ojha

Nykaa shows strong revenue expansion across its verticals, indicating a robust market position and opportunities for growth.

item.title: ITC shares now trade ex-hotels; Check stock price post demerger - CNBCTV18
item.description:
ITC Shares Trade Ex-Hotels Post-Demerger, Stock Price Set at ₹455.60

Date: January 6, 2025 Source: CNBC TV18

After a special trading session on January 6, ITC Ltd.'s market price is set at ₹455.60, following the spin-off of its hotels business.

  • The stock opened ₹26 lower following the demerger announcement.
  • Existing shareholders will receive one ITC Hotels share for every 10 ITC shares held.
  • ITC retains a 40% stake in the newly formed hotel entity.
  • ITC Hotels expected to list by mid-February 2025.
  • The expected market cap for ITC Hotels when listed ranges between ₹100-125 per share.
  • ITC Hotels plans to expand its portfolio from 140 to over 200 hotels by 2030.
“The demerger is expected to unlock substantial shareholder value.” - Prashanth Tapse, Mehta Equities

In conclusion, analysts remain optimistic about the potential growth and profitability of ITC Hotels, suggesting that the demerger could enhance shareholder value significantly.

item.title: Golden Globes 2025 live updates: No wins for India as All We Imagine As Light gets snubbed in both categories - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Golden Globes 2025 live updates: No wins for India as All We Imagine As Light gets snubbed in both categories

Date: January 5, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The 2025 Golden Globes saw significant recognition for various films, but India's entry, All We Imagine As Light, left the ceremony without any wins after being nominated in two categories.

  • Leading the nominations was Emilia Pérez with 10 nominations.
  • The ceremony took place on January 5, airing live and attracting significant viewership.
  • Despite nominations, India did not secure any awards.
“India didn’t win any awards despite being nominated in two categories.”

The Golden Globes continue to adapt after previous controversies, aiming for a more engaging and entertaining show.

item.title: From Early Morning Routine To Dinner, This Full-Day Meal Plan Will Keep You Healthy In Winter - NDTV Food
item.description:
Full-Day Meal Plan for Healthy Winter Eating

Publication Date: Not specified Source: NDTV Food

Winter poses health challenges such as dry skin and reduced immunity. Dietitian Manpreet Kalra shares a balanced meal plan focused on seasonal foods to maintain warmth and vitality during this season.

Here's Ideal Full-Day Meal Plan For Winter, Suggested By Expert:

  1. Morning: Start with a cup of coriander seeds water for detoxification and improved digestion.
  2. Breakfast: Enjoy vegetable poha for energy and nourishment.
  3. Mid-Morning Snack: Drink black carrot kanji for gut health.
  4. Lunch: Have methi & bajra stuffed rotis with mint-coriander chutney for a wholesome meal.
  5. Post-Lunch: Sip fennel-ajwain water to aid digestion.
  6. Evening Snack: Green tea with roasted makhana for antioxidants and protein.
  7. Dinner: Conclude with broccoli & carrot soup for a light, nutritious end to the day.

Best Winter Picks for Specific Health Needs:

  • Thyroid Health: Kalonji and coriander seeds tea.
  • Diabetes: Methi and bajra-stuffed roti.
  • Gut Health: Black carrot kanji.
  • Skin Health: Red carrot salad.
  • Immunity: Fresh ginger and turmeric tea.
  • Hair Health: Aliv seeds ladoo.

Dietitian Manpreet Kalra’s meal plan advocates a healthy, seasonal diet for overall well-being in winter.

item.title: Why Modi govt 3.0 is maintaining an arm’s length from protesting farmers - The Indian Express
item.description:
Why Modi govt 3.0 is maintaining an arm’s length from protesting farmers

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Indian Express

The article discusses the Indian government's reluctance to engage with protesting farmers who have been calling for a legal guarantee for minimum support prices and other reforms. The Union Agriculture Minister has indicated the government is waiting for Supreme Court directives before initiating talks.

  • The protests are led by the Samyukta Kisan Morcha and Kisan Mazdoor Morcha.
  • Farmers have been protesting at the Punjab-Haryana borders since February last year.
  • The current government is taking a more hands-off approach compared to previous administrations.
“Abhi to Supreme Court dekh raha hai. Supreme Court ke jo nirdesh honge unaka paalan kiya jaega.” - Shivraj Singh Chouhan

The article highlights a shift in the Modi government's strategy towards farmer protests, emphasizing caution and reliance on judicial outcomes rather than direct negotiations.

item.title: Flights cancelled, icy roads, power outages: Severe winter storm grips US - The Times of India
item.description:
Flights cancelled, icy roads, power outages: Severe winter storm grips US

Publication Date: January 2023 | Source: Major News Website

This severe winter storm has led to widespread flight cancellations, hazardous road conditions, and significant power outages throughout the United States, affecting thousands of residents.

  • Thousands of flights have been cancelled due to heavy snowfall and icy conditions.
  • Roads have become treacherous, prompting travel advisories in multiple states.
  • Power outages have impacted millions, with emergency services responding to downed lines.
  • Authorities advise residents to stay indoors and avoid unnecessary travel.
“This storm is particularly dangerous, and we urge everyone to heed local advisories.”

This winter storm is causing significant disruptions and challenges across the U.S., marking one of the harshest weather events this season.

item.title: I saw Samsung’s new OLED TV with Glare Free 2.0 tech, and it fixes the Samsung S95D’s biggest problem - TechRadar
item.description:
Samsung's New OLED TV with Glare Free 2.0 Tech Addresses Screen Reflection Issues

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: TechRadar

The Samsung S95F, which will feature the new Glare Free 2.0 technology, aims to tackle one of the key problems facing OLED TVs: screen reflections from ambient light sources. The latest tech promises improved black levels and shadow detail.

  • Samsung 2025 TVs feature new-gen 'Glare Free' tech.
  • Glare Free 2.0 better retains black depth and shadow detail.
  • Will feature in flagship OLED, and 8K and 4K mini-LED TVs.
“Enhancing black expression” along with rejecting glare is the primary focus of Glare Free 2.0 technology.

This new technology positions Samsung competitively against both established and emerging brands in the OLED market.
